data.title: Alexander VII (Pope)
data.meta_description: Alexander VII was head of the Catholic Church and ruler of the Papal States from 1655 until his death in 1667. He is particularly well known for his vision...
data.text:
Full Name: Fabio Chigi

Profession: Pope

Biography: Alexander VII was head of the Catholic Church and ruler of the Papal States from 1655 until his death in 1667. He is particularly well known for his vision as regards urban and architectural projects in Rome.

Fabio Chigi, as he was known prior to his papacy, started out serving in various diplomatic positions as a representative of the Holy See. He subsequently became a priest and then bishop of Nardo, and later bishop of Imola.

Under Pope Innocent X, Chigi was first appointed secretary of state and then made a cardinal. This positioned him to be elected pope after a discussion of eighty days, with Chigi taking the name of Alexander VII.

While he was initially elected as a response to the rampant nepotism which had plagued prior papacies, soon enough the papacy of Alexander VII ended up in much same boat as had those prior.

Born: February 13, 1599

Birthplace: Siena, Florence, Italy

Star Sign: Aquarius
